title: Unable to install truffle with npm on WSL
body:
- [x] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

Unable to install truffle with npm on WSL

## Steps to Reproduce
```
root@Surface-Book-2:~# sudo npm install truffle -g
npm WARN deprecated flat@4.1.0: Fixed a prototype pollution security issue in 4.1.0, please upgrade to ^4.1.1 or ^5.0.1.
/root/.nvm/versions/node/v12.18.2/bin/truffle -> /root/.nvm/versions/node/v12.18.2/lib/node_modules/truffle/build/cli.bundled.js

> truffle@5.1.43 postinstall /root/.nvm/versions/node/v12.18.2/lib/node_modules/truffle
> node ./scripts/postinstall.js

sh: 1: node: Permission denied
npm WARN optional SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: fsevents@~2.1.2 (node_modules/truffle/node_modules/chokidar/node_modules/fsevents):
npm WARN notsup SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY: Unsupported platform for fsevents@2.1.3: wanted {"os":"darwin","arch":"any"} (current: {"os":"linux","arch":"x64"})

npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! syscall spawn
npm ERR! file sh
npm ERR! errno ENOENT
npm ERR! truffle@5.1.43 postinstall: `node ./scripts/postinstall.js`
npm ERR! spawn ENOENT
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the truffle@5.1.43 postinstall script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /root/.npm/_logs/2020-09-08T05_50_22_436Z-debug.log
```

## Environment

* Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS **WSL** on Windows 10.0.19041
* Ethereum client: -
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): -
* node version (`node --version`): v12.18.2
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.14.5

Just for completeness, from Gitter...
```
@GitHubCloud You should not use sudo to install Truffle. I recommend using nvm and using it with npm as npm recommends this. https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally
Doing so should eliminate your permissions errors.
```

> Just for completeness, from Gitter...
> 
> ```
> @GitHubCloud You should not use sudo to install Truffle. I recommend using nvm and using it with npm as npm recommends this. https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally
> Doing so should eliminate your permissions errors.
> ```

I'm originally used `npm install truffle -g`, but it didn't work, and the error above shows that is some permission denied error, so i'm adding `sudo` to try it out.

I've tried change npm's global directory, but it didn't work either.
Using yarn can install properly, so never mind with npm, thanks anyway.
